website_summaries.verdict: Feature rich option with flywheel resistance at a decent price that can support multiple users.
pros: The bike is easy to assemble and quiet to ride
Adjusting the seat for different users is simple
A good set of speakers and an easy-to-read screen allow the user to enjoy up to 25 resistance levels and 29 pre-programmed workouts
cons: The included fan is not as powerful as some might have liked

website_summaries.verdict: Quiet operation and a feature-loaded console, along with the comfort and ease of its recumbent setup, make this a winner of an exercise bike.
pros: Bluetooth capability allows uploads from Schwinn’s Trainer app
Easy to put together and set up
Runs very quiet, with a large, easy-to-read console
cons: Heart-rate contact sensors are inaccurate unless gripped exactly right
Built-in speakers are tinny at best
Shorter users may find this bike uncomfortable

website_summaries.verdict: Easy assembly and impressive features. Smooth, effective workout routines. This exercise bike has its competitors beat on almost every front.
pros: Features a multi-function, twin LCD display with more than 29 advanced settings for monitoring workouts and tracking health metrics
cons: At 101 pounds, it's not something you'd want to move often

customer_reviews.title: ARRIVED BADLY DAMAGED RUINING THE EXPERIENCE
customer_reviews.text: The bike arrived in a box that was dropped so many times, or so hard, the styrofoam in it protecting the parts was pulverized. There were parts damaged as a result. The number they have you call is sending out one, but not all of the broken parts---and was like "What do you want for $549.00?" I didn't want my experience ruined and a beat up machine with the heart rate monitor not working. That is what I wanted for $549.00.
customer_reviews.author: rich brounhauser

customer_reviews.title: After three weeks it's broke.
customer_reviews.text: Had it three weeks and it's already broke. I got the warranty and am waiting to hear if they're going to honor it. I had high hopes. After a few seconds of pedaling it comes up "workout paused". This seems to be a common issue with Schwinn models.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: I Wish I Had Read All the 1 Star Reviews On Poor Packaging & Shipping Prior To Ordering
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. The pictures tell the story. It is being returned for obvious reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn E. Robbie

customer_reviews.title: Great & good quality
customer_reviews.text: This bike was not too bad to put together, all nuts & bolts were explained & it comes with the tools to do it. So far I like this exercise bike. You can set up your own resistance when pedaling. Has miles, minutes, heartbeat,calories etc. USB port, speakers, adjustable three speed fan. My husband uses it a lot, he has bad knees & when he uses this & gos to bed later, he has no restless sleepless nights, like he used to. So great bike, good exercise, good strong machine.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Equipment failure after 20 hours of use
customer_reviews.text: The right crank shaft failed due to stripping where the pedal screws into the shaft after about only 20 hours or so of use. Replacement parts under warranty took about a month to ship, included confusing and incomplete instructions, and required me to spend money out of pocket to buy a socket wrench and 9/16" fitting.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Defective bike and poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: The bike was delivered in early June and started having problems right after assembly with broken shank first and inaccurate readings on console next. The trouble shooting tips from Nautilus are very poor and despite multiple visits by their designated technician, no one can figure out what the problem with the bike is! Looking for replacement here.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Athletic club quality for the home
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking, for some time, for an athletic club quality recumbent bike for my home. This Schwinn meets that requirement without breaking the bank or requiring an engineering degree with a Japanese/ Chinese language fluency to put it together. 1.5 hours, including eating lunch, to assemble. No special tools required . Works like a dream. Excellent value!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Wish I Purchased This Sooner!!!
customer_reviews.text: This bike was a great purchase. It is appropriate for everyone regardless of your level of fitness. The seat is large and comfortable. The bike petals smoothly. Initially the right petal made a clunking sound, (as some reviewers mentioned), but once I pointed it out to my husband (who assembled the bike to begin with) he opened the cover/hood over the front wheel and investigated. He said the screws on the fly wheel were too tight which caused rubbing on the cover/hood. Once he loosened them everything was great. Problem resolved!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. B

customer_reviews.title: the person that was to assemble it never did show up
customer_reviews.text: So far, it's great, it would have been 5 stars, if the manual was more clear about how to do different difficulty in rides, the "ride in the park" seemed like a ride up mt fuji! but then we're old :) I ordered this partly because of the free assembly, which did not happen, I waited all day for the assembler, and didn't get a call, didn't get any notice that they weren't going to show up on time, after a few calls, they said I could try waiting around all day another time, which I declined, if you get this bike, I wouldn't pay a dime to Colby Holding Company Inc for the installation.
customer_reviews.author: tim

customer_reviews.title: A Great Recumbent Bike!
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this bike for a couple of months now and am quite pleased with it. The info I had read about this 270 was accurate. Although when it was originally shipped via UPS the parcel was torn and some of the packing bands were missing and the assembler said there appeared to be some chips, dents, etc. Amazon came thru and sent a replacement which their assembler did an excellent job of putting it together and going over the instructions for using the digital panel. Yes, the original was picked up by UPS and returned to Amazon in the meantime..
customer_reviews.author: Anon.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working within a year
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for awhile and I loved using it, but it didn’t even last a year. It stopped working out of the blue one day and won’t start up again. The display is just dark. No sound or anything. I see other reviewers with the same problem. It’s too expensive for this bs. You get one star. Boo.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley King

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it before trying it and don't accept deliver if it comes in a broken box (it will)
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in a broken box (as did 2 others that I bought -manufacturer's fault). Did not function properly and arranging for repairs turned into a nightmare. Wasted about 10 hours unpacking, assembling, dis-assembling, repacking. Seat back is very, very uncomfortable and cannot be replaced or adjusted. Can't believe all the high ratings for this product on the Internet. Fake endorsements!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: comfortable, easy to adjust position and very easy programing for two people
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble...watched assembly video on the Internet and only needed instruction manual to see which bolts/washers went where. Fully assembled in less than one hour and worked on first attempt...
customer_reviews.author: The Guardian

customer_reviews.title: Works great, seat could be better
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Works great and it's an easy way to keep in shape because I can just jump on it while I'm watching tv. The only draw back is that the seat is uncomfortable and a little flimsy. When I ride it for more than 30 or 40 minutes my butt starts to hurt. I could also see it being a problem for very heavy people. I'm 185 and it's okay, but someone 220+ might break it if they're not careful.
customer_reviews.author: James Sellers

customer_reviews.title: My Schwinn 270 Recument Bike
customer_reviews.text: This item was shipped as promise. Very easy to put together. Everything labeled good and even supplied the tools. Being an ex bicycle racer and owner of a Waterford frame (a hand built Schwinn) I feel like I can give pretty decent review. For the price, I think this is a 5 star. I would give a 4 star. A little wobbly while peddling but not too bad. Of course some people might complain about the pedal straps, but they are very good, once again for the price.
customer_reviews.author: funkerpoke

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Packaged well and Super easy to put together. And incredibly easy to use. We love hooking up our phone to the speakers and the fact that it has a fan to cool you down. The seat is comfortable and so are the foot pedals. I would definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: James P

customer_reviews.title: ok but nothing special
customer_reviews.text: bike is fine but more or less the same electronics that has been on exercise equipment for the past 20 years. has an app but it is useless. has Bluetooth but not enough sensors to connect to any of the cool apps available. so sad another $5 in parts and it could be a great bike.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Morris

customer_reviews.title: Very disgusted. I enjoyed it for 4 weeks
customer_reviews.text: The computer on this exercise bike only worked for 35 days. I used it 2-3 x wk for 4 weeks and then the computer just stopped turning on. Now after this has been completely assembled, we'll need to take it apart &, find a very large box to ship back. Was hoping we could just exchange the very top part /the computer but no. Very disgusted. I enjoyed it for 4 weeks. Annoyance
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Brand new defective unit
customer_reviews.text: Nice bike BUT the resistance doesn't work. No difference between the lowest to highest level. Now the fun begins trying to get Schwinn to repair or replace. Hopefully they send a tech for in-house service. Not good for a brand new item.
customer_reviews.author: L. Kostolanci

customer_reviews.title: Good bike.
customer_reviews.text: Nice bike. Very sturdy and heavy. Took my husband and I about 2 hours to put together. I tried to purchase the set up that amazon offers but they couldn’t find anyone in my area to put it together. It should not be offered if they can’t find anyone. Other than that I’m satisfied. I use it daily.
customer_reviews.author: fonzie

customer_reviews.title: Arrived the next day and was easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Arrived the next day and was easy to assemble. However after five minutes of use it began to make a loud clunk in the vicinity of the motor. This clunk proceeded to get more frequent and regarless of speed or tension, persisted. It was also noticeable with the machine turned off. We decided not to spend more time and money trying to get it repaired and have given it to a fitness equipment repair person.
customer_reviews.author: Kathlyn N. Paxton

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money. Uncomfortable for seniors.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 230 but should have bought the more expensive one because the seat and back rest are so uncomfortable! I am already having back issues where the seat bends at the lower middle. I was used to the old model that I might have had for 20 years where the seat was padded and it was really sturdy. This one feels so unstable when you bend to the side. I wish I could get my old one back but it’s at the landfill. I cannot find a seat cover to fit it and wish the company made one that I could buy.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Sabet

customer_reviews.title: Beware Assemble Right Away
customer_reviews.text: Beware once you get the product start assembling it. It's Challenging you should think 1.5-2hrs of Focused. Have a good philips screwdriver and blade/pocket knife handy. After a few days the console stops at 5 seconds and workout paused. yes, i'm pedaling and yes electrical is connected. Trouble shooted with Tech - Yes 45min wait time calling Schwinn. it's CRAZY. Tech said will send a technician & parts but will take 2 weeks - Sigh! Don't know if Amazon will take back. I will update review. Thank you Amazon they are taking it back. Take home message - BEWARE. Watch out for the Return Policy of 30days! Seriously
customer_reviews.author: D.C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT! It takes about an hour with help to put the bike together. It does NOT come with a compete user manual. You have to go online and download it. WHY? seems a bit stupid not to ship one with the bike. Other than that I LOVE this bike! I've set mine up in the living room. I workout on it 30 min a day. Time just flies by. I've had to stop Jazzercise because of lower back issues. I can already tell this bike it strengthening my lower back and core muscles. NO impact on joints either. Just sit and start paddling!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Solar

customer_reviews.title: Cheap seat. Inexpensive plastic.
customer_reviews.text: Seat back made of inexpensive plastic. Uncomfortable for wife. After i assembled the bike, she knew within 1 minute that she wasn't going to live with this machine. May be great for others, but not for her. Bought Life Cycle RS3. Excellent bike. More $, but in the long run well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Banks

customer_reviews.title: Bike died, no reply from customer service
customer_reviews.text: It was a good bike while it lasted. It died a couple of weeks ago. I wrote to Schwinn/Nautilus customer service, but got no reply. The problem is that after 5 seconds of pedaling, the bike thinks you've stopped pedalling when you haven't. I read the troubleshooting guide. I tried cleaning the sensor and the magnets. Then I ordered new cables and replaced those. Still nothing. I guess I will have to buy from another manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Opinionated

customer_reviews.title: Worse product I have ever bought from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I would give them zero if I could. Three months after I bought the product it quit working. Call customer support and was told "it's under warranty but only for parts". I was required to try and fix it myself. This is ridiculous. I've since tried to fix the bike. It is a very detailed process and I can not do it. I will never buy from Schwinn/Nautilus again. They should be sued.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Deering

customer_reviews.title: Seat flaw makes this almost unrideable
customer_reviews.text: The seat wobbles left and right even when securely bolted in place because the slider they have it connected to wobbles. It feels like you are in a boat going over waves when you ride it. I can't believe I just wasted 2.5 hours putting this together only for it to be pretty much useless. Not I'm going to have to take it all apart to return it. What a complete waste of time and energy.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron J. Collins

customer_reviews.title: would buy again...pay attention to the magnet/wheel sensor alignment.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very heavy...so far it supports my weight very well. whisper quiet operation except the beep every 2 minutes(need to figure out how to lower that volume). comfortable padded seat, can't say anything bad about this thing except that the magnet sensor had to be adjusted because it kept going into pause mode after i started pedaling....now works fine. something to watch for if you buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2ND TO NONE...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to assemble. I put it together because my husband was at work when it arrived, and I didn't want to wait for him. I was very anxious to put it to good use, and I did! The bike is comfortable, especially the seat, which was one of my great concerns. It is quiet when pedaling, and the different levels gives a fantastic choice of workouts, which works every muscle in the legs and buttocks. I LOVE, LOVE, 💕💕💕 my Schwinn. It completes my in home gym!!!
customer_reviews.author: Murial T. Henry

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and mostly met my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and mostly met my expectations. Only small issue is the internal fan is not pointing directly to the rider but offset a little to the left... Didn't need or want the color graphics or preset programs to start but might take advantage of with more time on bike. Shelf comes in handy to allow for watching my 11"tablet and the seat is comfortable enough. I added a mesh lumbar support and it did the trick!
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on recumbent bikes and decided to go with the Schwinn 230. I was a bit worried about ordering it on line and putting it together. I received it all intact, including all parts and instructions. Easy to assemble. Peddling is very smooth and quiet. The seat is surprisingly comfortable. I have arthritis in my hips, knees and feet and using this recumbent bike makes exercise comfortable and fun. I am really happy I bought this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase & great customer support
customer_reviews.text: The 270 was very easy to assemble, although I did notice a few mistakes in the instructions, but all went well. While unpacking I noticed that much of the foam blocks were damaged, and on further inspection noticed that the front shrouds were cracked. A quick call to Nautilus, where I connected with Maddie, resolved any issues. Replacement parts were on the way, and delivered in 5 days. I am in the customer service industry, and I could only hope that our service is as great as my experience with Nautilus.
customer_reviews.author: Marke503

customer_reviews.title: Don’t wast your money!
customer_reviews.text: This bike is a complete and total waste of money. We’ve had it for a few months and it’s been broken most of that time. Customer support sent us a tool and a sensor to fix it but no instructions on what to do. I am livid that there are no repair people anywhere near us so I’m just out this money. Currently it takes up space in my exercise room. I would definitely not recommend buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher G. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: The bike is good; seat is not so good
customer_reviews.text: Bike was fairly easy to setup for its size. The seat is okay, but it kind of causes you to slide down it a lot. It could probably be engineered better. Recently my bike has stopped working and I'm waiting for a replacement part from Nautilus. Hopefully that resolves it, but kind of sad that it broke in 7 months. I haven't used any of the advanced features like playing music, or syncing with my pc, or anything like that. I just hit quick start and up the resistance and bike for 30-40 mins.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M.

customer_reviews.title: seat wobbles, bike not sturdily built, bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: As other negative reviewers have noted, the seat wobbles as I peddle the bike. I'll admit that I weigh 250 pounds, but the bike is supposed to handle up to 300 pounds. I contacted Schwinn customer service by email but never got a response. The bike is built too lightly; I returned it to Amazon. There are good aspects to the bike. Assembly is straight forward. It peddles smoothly and quietly, and the electronic display is easy to understand and operate if you read the directions first. But if you are larger and/or ride vigorously, you need to spend more on a better exercise bike.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous Work Out Equipment
customer_reviews.text: Schwinn 270 Recumbent Bike (MY17) is a terrible and unsafe work out. The elevated angles for which the seat to pedals are pitched; regardless of length, over exaggerate the use of the quads. After about 3 workouts the strain on your IT bands is unbearable. I'm seeing my Physical Therapist daily to return my IT bands to normal. I had to have professional help assmbling the bike so it could be put to proper use and it still caused injury. Now they won't return the bike. I'm out $759 and the cost of my PT!
customer_reviews.author: the-real-review

customer_reviews.title: Pedals click with each rotation
customer_reviews.text: This bike is uncomfortable and clicks with each rotation of the pedals. The pedal straps at their longest do not extend around the middle of my shoe (women’s size 9) so I can only comfortably use it in socks. The clicking, discomfort of the seat, and discomfort of the pedals makes it easier to drive to the gym and use the equipment there.
customer_reviews.author: Twade

customer_reviews.title: Great for comfortable workouts, except for the whole legs burning thing.
customer_reviews.text: I've waited until I really put some time on this before reviewing, This is mainly for the winter months so I don't lose my conditioning for long summer tours. It was straight forward to put together and the only change was a couple of rubber washers under the rear of the seat to tilt it a little more. Very quite and plenty of different work out programs. It was on sale when I bought it and I was worried it might turn out to be cheaply made but, no I am happy with it. I can go for a long calorie burning ride or a short intense workout. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: robert b. mccormick

customer_reviews.title: ASSEMBLY NIGHTMARE
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, solid bike. Very well made, and close to as good as ones I used in physical therapy. The seat is sturdy and it hardly makes any sound. My only complaint, it was an absolute pain to assemble. If you are a senior or disabled in any way; you won’t be able to assemble this bike alone. I would have given it 5 stars except for the assembly.
customer_reviews.author: denise p.

customer_reviews.title: It is easily adjustable
customer_reviews.text: My 10-year-old exercise bike was falling apart (the buttons didn't work), so I replaced it. Construction was time consuming but no difficult. Pros: 1) it is really easy to adjust, just lift the lever up and you can slide the seat, no more hole and bolt spaced an inch apart (2) the display is backlit (3) the bottoms work (4) it has Bluetooth for logging your exercise. Cons: (1) i still have not figured out the different programs (2) it won't play music via Bluetooth, you have to plug into the audio jack.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: This bike seems solid, and it's quiet
customer_reviews.text: For a person that isn't into (or very good at) assembly, this was easy to put together. When I did so, I learned how well built this machine seems to be. Only time will tell, but my first week with this bike tells me it's a good buy. I've found only one flaw: the heart rate monitor is all over the place. My Apple watch does a nice job as a monitor. It almost perfectly mirrors the monitor of the bike at the gym. Usually within 1 or 2 bpm. Not the Schwinn. That's a small issue for me. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: tramborder

customer_reviews.title: Bad electronics. Cumbersome assembly!
customer_reviews.text: We followed assembly instructions that took over 2 hours. Once assembled, we realized the seat is not very comfortable. That wasn’t the issue. None of the electronics turned on. We checked all connections and tried different outlets. Amazon’s customer service was great. They processed a return right away. Amazon A+ Schwinn F.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Well built and easy to use, with some minor items noticed.
customer_reviews.text: Meets all of our expectations. Assembly a no-brained. Startup and ease of use straight forward and easy. Two negatives; one small and one to me larger. 1.) the seat needs to come stock with an integrated gel cushion. Rides of an hour or more can cause tail bone chaffing without a towel or cushion down there. 2.) I am a avid Fitbit user and this unit interfaces directly with NON-Fitbit apps only. Someone needs to develop a Fitbit interface with the Schwinn Trainer App and this unit would be TOP of the LINE. I will be glad to be a beta.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Hoover

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable machine I have found for an aerobic workout!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a 20 year old treadmill that was on its last legs. I did a lot of research, found this unit at or near the top of several review sites. It is very smooth, whisper quiet, and just begs to be used. The fan is great idea, but it doesn't blow any better than a $10.00 9" ntable fa,. The speakers are surprisingly good, But I immediately replaced the audio cable because it was too short, and prone to hum. No matter, I usually have headphones or earbuds on while I work out. The usb port appears to be no more than 1 amp, but it is adequate for my tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Burns

customer_reviews.title: Recumbant Bike
customer_reviews.text: I placed this bike in the living area of a senior living apartment where I cannot fail to notice that I should be on it. So far I'm riding it more than I got myself to the gym which was the idea in purchasing it, and at 87 years of age this has to be a good idea. It is not as smooth as riding the recumbent bikes at the gym but I suppose they are designed to be better and probably much more expensive. Overall, it seems to be a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: Have not had it long, but so far it seems great! My husband has been through two stints of physical therapy (heart surgery and knee pain) and both times, the recumbent bike was part of the routine. We figured we might as well get one to make it easier to keep the routine going. I’ve jumped on as well and can feel that it is capable of giving quite the workout. And I love the fact that I can distract myself with videos on my iPad in the process.
customer_reviews.author: Zengrl

customer_reviews.title: We love this bike!! Great for anyone.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike for my teen son and myself. I exercise a lot, he does not. But, he enjoys biking indoors and likes the programs offered. The seat is large, and provides great back support and is very comfortable for both of us. I will add that he is 6'2" and fits fine on it. We expect he will grow another inch, and expect his long legs will still fit. The seat is easy to adjust. The bike is quiet, but when the program is set and when it ends, it will make a brief beeping sound. I would buy this bike again, and I recommend it for any age, and for anyone needing back support.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Well-made and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I need to exercise daily and I hate going to the gym. I also cannot lift weights. But I can ride a bike. Thats why I've got a Schwinn, a bike company blast from my past. It is very easy to use, well-designed and stable. It's programmable and the seat is very supportive and comfortable. I'm enjoying my new Schwinn.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike after having knee surgery. I believe I will get great use out of it afterwards as well. Nicely made, feels very sturdy, no wobbles. Has many great features, I'm very pleased with it, I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Stel

customer_reviews.title: Well made for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This bike was a replacement for another bike we had that stopped working after 12 years. I researched many brands and sites as well as locally for a new one and decided on this one. I was looking for one in the 300-600 dollar range that had good reviews, recumbent with a chair like seat and a place to hold an iPad that I could watch while exercising. This fit all my criteria. I also liked that it was made by Schwinn. It’s used daily by multiple people and works well. The pedaling motion is smooth with different workouts and resistance levels. We put it together ourselves and accomplished the task in about 3 hours.
customer_reviews.author: gw81

customer_reviews.title: Low quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am really not happy with this product. It is far less durable then advertised. The seat is a bit small and the adjustments are very low quality. The speakers and fan are pretty much something you would expect out of a $150.00 product, not a $500.00 product. The handle and display are very low quality as well as positioned very poorly. Had I not already assembled this I would have sent it back. If you are going to spend this kind of money I would look elsewhere for a better quality bike.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Liss

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: if you take the time to watch the you tube video on assembly, it will go much easier and faster than you think. Small washer parts are kind of confusing as to which goes where. Took 2 of us less than a half an hour to put it together. Quiet and sturdy. Hoping this bike holds up for years. My hubby is a big guy at 6ft 3 and he still has a little room on it if he were taller.
customer_reviews.author: Holli Gomes

customer_reviews.title: Convenient bike ride
customer_reviews.text: Great recumbent bike. Purchased because taking walks outside was difficult in our hot weather....now I can ride whenever I like...set up a show on my iPad, turn on the built in fan on the bike, and ride as long as I want. Bike is comfortable and great exercise whenever I want. Sturdy and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Ken B

customer_reviews.title: Two broke in under a month. Beware!!
customer_reviews.text: These bikes are awesome, while they work. First one lasted 1 week of daily biking and then it started thumping as the pedals were turned. I sent it back and got a replacement. 2nd one lasted 30 days till it just ground to a halt. Return window closed yesterday. Loved the programs, seats were comfy and loved how whisper quiet both were till they slipped a belt or something. I'm not very happy and will be contacting Amazon and schwinn. Once, okay, I'm sure a bad one happens now and again. Twice, and I'm just quite simply not happy about this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A. Swan

customer_reviews.title: Solid Hardware but no instructions
customer_reviews.text: The assembly took about an hour. I would not recommend that you attempt it alone or unless you have experience assembling large complicated hardware. The package weighs over 100#. Assembly instructions are complete. However, I have not found any user instructions. None in the owners' manual. None on the internet. None on the companion app either. Good luck trying to monitor your numeric heart rate. Speaking of the app, it would rate a grade of C in my elementary computer programming class. No instructions here either.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Similar to the machine at the gym.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, took three hours to assemble, is very heavy, takes a lot of space, and I use it every day since the gym is off limits for the coronavirus lockdown. I have bad joints, arthritis, and very limited mobility. I walk with two canes or a walker. This device is non weight bearing and is helping me recover some range of motion in my legs. It’s better than a trip to the physical therapist and I can control the pain level without verbal harassment! Gain without pain is possible after all!!😀
customer_reviews.author: Keyboard K

customer_reviews.title: Two Thumbs Up! A Quality Recumbent!
customer_reviews.text: I love riding this sturdy bike. I am 6'1", 162 lbs, and this bike fits me easily. I find the workout to be enjoyable and quiet. I found the assembly to be easy, and it took me about 90 minutes. The instructions were excellent, and the small parts well identified. I did download on my phone the Schwinn Trainer App. It gives you a nice summary of your workouts. One thing to watch for are price changes. They move up and down, so be patient. So after one week and 50 miles, I give it 5 stars! I like everything about this bike. I also recommend the Schwinn Airdyne, which I have owned for yrs.
customer_reviews.author: Perkasie

customer_reviews.title: Should have ordered the 270
customer_reviews.text: I had the 270 model and it petered out after 4 years so I replaced it with this 230 model. I thought they were similar enough to justify the price difference of about $180, but I made the wrong choice. The 230 model is well made but I liked the 270 much better because I found it a little more comfortable, had bigger pedals and the screen was easier to read. Compared with other models on the market at this price the 230 compares well, so I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom L

customer_reviews.title: Solid quiet and smooth....just wish the heart monitor wasn't so erratic.
customer_reviews.text: What did I like...solid, quiet, and will definitely provide the user with the opportunity to experience a great low impact cardio workout. What I didn't like...screw heads are easily stripped...heart monitor is so erratic that it can be considered useless..display screens are not user friendly...operating instructions are more based on what buttons "will do" versus "how to use" the buttons to begin workout or during workout.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Smith

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed after knee surgery.
customer_reviews.text: Having used 2000 dollar recumbent bikes in rehab I wasn't sure I'd like this bike. After using it, it works great and I don't miss those expensive bikes at all. I had a knee replacement and this bike has really helped me get movement back in my knee. My rehab was finished but my knee wasn't in great shape yet. So now having my own exercise bike has really helped me get back into shape.
customer_reviews.author: garygromer

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this purchase, bike has a smooth pedaling mechanism and feels sturdy. Would be 5 stars but the seat is SO uncomfortable! It is hard plastic. My last Schwinn recumbent had a decent padded seat, why did they get rid of it? This new design is so bad that we even tried to retrofit the old seat, wouldn't work unfortunately. Anyway, everything else is great, this is our second Schwinn recumbent, so we like the brand, very reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Raindrop

customer_reviews.title: It works, will you?
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a bike close to what a gym uses. It’s not quite as smooth and easy so I have to put in more effort and work , but it’s a great bike nonetheless. You can change the tension easily and it has various programs that you can use and work up to if you work at it. Very sturdy, and I used the Amazon assembly service to put the bike together. Glad I did and it took only 1 1/2 hours max to do it.
customer_reviews.author: ASLYN

customer_reviews.title: Great bike!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this several times and from over the past couple of months from 30mins to 2hrs at a time and it’s GREAT! No noise, nice little fan, and a Good USB port for when I’m using my tablet or phone. The only thing I don’t like is the foot petal straps are a bit small. I can Only wear very thin shoes or houseshoes when on it. It it had a bigger foot strap it would be PERFECT!!! But for the price it STILL deserves 5⭐️
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Nautilus/schwinn bike 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good exercise bike ... use it everyday for 60 to 90 minutes... plus wife use it also for 30 minutes— so far so good... for the most part heart rate monitor works perfectly when compared to Apple Watch same heart rate reading— programs work great but limited to a few... btw I bought the 5 yr warranty from manufacturer-it’s Nautilus /bowflex and schwinn SAME COMPANY—it’s the same bike exactly as nautilus — everything is same down to programs parts look etc just 200 less
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for personal use
customer_reviews.text: I've used this bike for about 2 months now. Assembly was fairly straightforward. It about 45-60 minutes to assemble. The quality of the casing is not the best. It's not bad, but definitely on the cheaper side. There was a crack in part of the casing on arrival, but luckily it wasn't in an area that was visible or important after assembly. There is a wide range of resistances, and I haven't had any problems with the functional elements of the bike so far. The electronic panel is pretty good for this price range of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: km

customer_reviews.title: Great value in a recumbent stationary bike
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these Schwinn recumbent stationary bikes a few years ago. The older model was better in several ways. It had a better seat. It had better foot straps. And most importantly it had better cranks/pedals. My chief complaint on this New model is that it is far too easy to hit the inner heel of your shoe on the crank while pedaling. Put another way, if you are even a little bit slew footed (opposite of pigeon footed) it will be annoying to continually remember to point your toes inward while pedaling. But this is otherwise a decent and ridiculously affordable piece of exercise equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Dreifort

customer_reviews.title: good quality bike
customer_reviews.text: I used it for a year got resistance problems now wait for it..... I fixed it myself you take off the flywheel cover on the right side on the handlebar strut there are two 5/16 bolts loosen the bolts adjust your magnet travel (move magnet closer to flywheel) tighten you are done just put the cover back on small adjustments work better I have to do it again to much resistance
customer_reviews.author: S. L

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this machine
customer_reviews.text: I use this bike several times a week. The screen is easy to see, the bike is comfortable, and it's easy to adjust the resistance during your workout (important if you're doing high intensity interval training). The time screen is below the magazine/ipad holder, so I can keep track of my time while listening to TED talks on my ipad. I've seen some people complain about the hardness of the seat, but I think it's fine (and a cushion could be used if needed).
customer_reviews.author: Gen

customer_reviews.title: Great bike and Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Great bike!! Really like it a lot. Had to contact Schwinn about and issue with the console and was very impressed with the professionalism of the customer service representatives!!! Diagnosed the problem and immediately started to correct it. Schwinn sent me the tool to help me adjust a sensor free. Great customer service and really enjoy the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Retired USMC SgtMaj

customer_reviews.title: Great for smaller spaces.
customer_reviews.text: This recumbent is much smaller than it appears or the measurements would seem to indicate. I'm tall and can't get the seat to go back any further, and it is low to the ground. It is easy to move around as it is very light and not very long. I signed up to have someone come to the house to assemble it which is a good idea. It is functional but not as good as the larger Schwinn recumbent I had which was lost in a house fire. It should be OK for general exercise but nothing too involved.
customer_reviews.author: avid reader

customer_reviews.title: pain to assemble,  minimally useful led display
customer_reviews.text: First of all, it took my BIL, a former bike mechanic and hour and a half to put this thing together. It does work smoothly, but the readout is not very useful: no mph, no indication of resistance level (just "beeps") and no explanation in the manual of the "programs". To add insult to injury, the price dipped considerably just after I bought it, such that you can now get the better model the 270?) For what we paid. With that one you get color lcd display and ability to use Bluetooth to "ride along" on beautiful routes around the world. So still feeling a little screwed over by this purchase
customer_reviews.author: GDawg

customer_reviews.title: Item broke, warranty service is DIY
customer_reviews.text: Got the bike, broke withing 5 months with a loud clunking sound with every revolution of the pedals. Called Nautilus/Schwinn for warranty service. Hold times are always in excess of 1 hour. Then your have to disassemble the bike yourself to troubleshoot. After removing the cover to the main assembly, issue seemed to stop for a minute, but now it's back, so I'm back on hold with a 105 minute estimated hold time. Not worth the headache. Also their registration page has issues. Very frustrating, don't know what someone without tools would do.
customer_reviews.author: thomas a krogh

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike but terrible display panel!
customer_reviews.text: The bike is comfortable but the display panel is so complicated that it is ridiculous. It takes someone with a PhD to understand the manual and set up the display panel. I have spent hours and hours trying to set up the display panel and it is still not satisfactory. I would not purchase this if I knew how difficult the display panel set up was going to entail.
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Was so excited to give this as a Christmas gift ...
customer_reviews.text: Was so excited to give this as a Christmas gift for my hubby. After 2 months of use (2-3x/week) the console does not work. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A solid machine that gives great feedback and keeps me pumping hard
customer_reviews.text: This has met all my needs and expectations. It assembled easily and after two months of use at six days a week, it's rock solid. I'm 65 and wanted good aerobic workouts. This is the machine! I particularly like the two minute increments on the dash. When I go up in intensity, I can watch the time count down. I just tell myself I've just got to keep up the effort for two minutes.... And then the next two and so on. I put on music and pedal away. I am very happy with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: S. Chase

customer_reviews.title: Not bad..
customer_reviews.text: Arrived fast as stated. East to assemble, especially with a helper. Seat has room for improvement. I’m 5-8 and 300#, I like the bike but I would recommend a better one if your a big person. My son is 5-10 and 210# and he fits well on it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric J. Bittner

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Bike post knee surgery
customer_reviews.text: Confirming all the previous reviews about how great this bike is. Works for me 6'3" and my wife 5'2". Not an overload on electronic features but just enough. Also the Amazon delivery and setup was OUTSTANDING.
customer_reviews.author: WLAZ

customer_reviews.title: This actually wasn't too bad to assemble - despite the instructions
customer_reviews.text: This actually wasn't too bad to assemble - despite the instructions. The red ring that is at the base of the handlebars needs to be put on before everything is put together. (someone must have recognized this as an issue an cut mine so I could wrap around base instead of taking apart & re-assembling) Other than that, pretty much no frills. As others have mentioned only two users can store info. Bike is solid. Note: The seat isn't padded, if that is important to you. I was asked about using this bike for someone over 6' tall. The seat doesn't go that far back. I'm only 5'7 and probably have another 4-5" that it can go back.
customer_reviews.author: Louis U. Valanzola

customer_reviews.title: Quality bike, but bribe a friend to help put it together
customer_reviews.text: I find this ti be a good quality exercise bike, almost as good as the Dynex bikes that I like at the gym. And this is actually better, because I can use it anytime I want, not just during the gym's hours. The biggest negative that I have found,, so far, is that you should definitely have two people to put it together. Granted, I'm not mechanically inclined, but I still think you need two people, just physically, to put it together, Time will tell how it holds up over time, but so far, I'm pleased with it. Also, I bought this from the Amazon Warehouse, as the original packaging was damaged, and I wouldn't hesitate to do so again.
customer_reviews.author: birder1

customer_reviews.title: Arrived in good shape and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I was a little nervous after seeing some of the negative reviews. But my box arrived in perfect shape, all the pieces were in there. Assembly is very straight forward and there is really no reason to to pay someone to do it or you. I've only used it once but it all seemed solid and exactly what I needed. Glad I went for this over the Diamondback as it was a little cheaper, 40lbs lighter, and so far seems to fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Doug G

customer_reviews.title: Solid and very quiet
customer_reviews.text: A nice machine that has many options aand performs quietly . It was fairly easy to assemble, less than an hour . All hardware is included. This one replaced my old one which was 23 years old. Only time will tell if this will go 23 years as well. Update: The digital readout for time and workout info. keeps going crazy and not settling on numbers etc. Will check for a loose connection, but if that doesn't prove the case, not sure what can be happening.
customer_reviews.author: Veteran shopper

customer_reviews.title: No back pressure
customer_reviews.text: For several years, I've used a training wheel that attaches to the rear wheel of my bicycle. However, my back began to ache with that apparatus. So I decided to try this recumbent setup. What a major improvement! It's relatively painless to assemble and is sturdy. The only drawback is that the software that can supposedly be downloaded for free, can't be (at least not for Macintosh computers. Still, I can program the resistance, time, and length of session, so am very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Killingsworth

customer_reviews.title: Electronics not durable
customer_reviews.text: Bike malfunctioned after 4 months. Display & resistance quit working.
customer_reviews.author: applesagan

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed, Easy to Assemble and Quiet
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed by the quality of the parts as every piece fit easily and perfectly into each other. Assembly was a breeze and the resulting unit is extremely strong. The bike is very comfortable and easy to use. It is also quieter than I believed possible. The dashboard has many options, but operation can be as simple as pushing one button to start. Due to the ease of use, the comfort and the quietness of the bike, I have used it even more than I had expected. It would be hard to imagine a better recumbent exercise bike.
customer_reviews.author: John Fountain

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love my bike
customer_reviews.text: This is a great recumbent bike, the features are comparable to bikes I have used at the gym, yet I am in the privacy of my home. The bike is super quiet, so I can ride and not disturb my hubby when we are both in the same room.
customer_reviews.author: technorn

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and the hassle
customer_reviews.text: This bike was easy to put together and comfortable to sit on. however, during the middle of the first use the wheel began banging loudly. After taking it apart, it was clear the wheel hits the outside shield because it wobbles back and forth. Returning the bike was a HUGE mess! UPS refuses to ship the bike back because it is a freight item. After a afternoon speaking to several different people at Amazon and UPS, Amazon came through and sent a freight company to pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy T.

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't buy it again
customer_reviews.text: 1) The foot pedal straps are too short. I just removed them since my foot could barely get into it. 2) The drive keeps slipping. Very annoying and disruptive. 3) The seat won't stay in its position. I'm pretty tall so I move it towards the back but it keeps slipping forward. Knowing these problems, I should have purchased a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A.

customer_reviews.title: Need 2 people assemble
customer_reviews.text: Assembly very straightforward. You really need 2 people to attach the upright for the console. You have to hold the upright tube and the main cover while plugging the wiring harness together. It takes three hands. Two negative comments: the pedals are too far apart. If you have spent any time on a real bike, it will feel awkward and the ride social app needs a lot of work. The 270 shows one speed and ride social shows a fraction of that speed. In my case, 13mph vs 2mph. I have not been able to get the two speeds closer together.
customer_reviews.author: bgibbs

customer_reviews.title: Schwinn Recumbent bike 230 , Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I just purchase the bike on Sunday May 10th, 2020. I bought the 230 and I must say, it is very quiet and sturdy. It feels like a commercial bike you would find at a major GYM. I am very pleased with the bike. I am 6 feet 2 and weigh over 250 lbs. It’s easy to assemble and it only take about an hour and a half. It would take less than that if you are good assembling things. Also , I am over 60 years old and I really like it. I would text this. Ike to my friends...
customer_reviews.author: alconusa

customer_reviews.title: The length and movability is good. The seat doesn't feel AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: I'm fat. 5'10'' , 300lbs I'm a guy, with a wide frame so I am always worried about "fit" with things. No issues with this bike. The length and movability is good. The seat doesn't feel AMAZING, but it's stable enough and has holes in the back so when I start sweating it breathes well. Also has place for water bottle... the fan is better than I expected... and it powers on and off without issue so far (I've had for approximately a month). Amazon offered free set up of this item, and the service scheduled efficiently and was in and out within an hour. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: itsjoeg

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike for everyday exercise
customer_reviews.text: The bike came well packed and the parts were light weight enough to be moved around. Assembly was easy, thanks to the clear instructions. The wire connectors are made of plastics and feel a bit cheap, but they seem to work well. The bike runs quietly, and the control panel is easy to navigate. A pleasant surprise is the speaker on the unit - it is loud, and the bass is strong, delivering better sound than my iPad’s speaker. Overall it is a solid performer, and I hope its long-term reliability will pass the test.
customer_reviews.author: Starkid

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I am cyclist. Had a stroke and could not ride for a while. Purchased this to keep active. I enjoy it and it keeps me exercising. My only hiccup is that the seat makes a rattle. I don't think it was our fault assembling because I have been to several stores in our area to see if they did the same....and they did.
customer_reviews.author: dodoburd

customer_reviews.title: Old technology but works well
customer_reviews.text: Displays and controls work but are outdated. USB doesn’t charge devices. Would be nice to have a device mount above the displays, too, or ideally, ability to use phone or tablet as a display. The seat doesn’t feel sturdy, but is comfortable and no issues so far. Overall the bike is functional and provides a smooth ride. Good for workouts.
customer_reviews.author: HeyHeyYou

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: We received the bike on December 14th and found it to be well packed with no damage. All parts were present and accounted for however this bike is a big challenge to put together, the instructions are not well written and very hard to follow, after three hours we had it up and running. Once you have it together it works like a champ. We have found the bike to be very mobile and easy to move and it will provide a great work out. The display panel is great and has many options that are useful. I will up date this review in six months.
customer_reviews.author: jamesbmcnellis

customer_reviews.title: Smooth, quiet ride
customer_reviews.text: I easily put it together in about an hour while watching some TV. The bike rides smoothly and quietly! The seat adjusts easily and is very comfortable and the venting on the back of the seat is a plus. The fan isn't overly powerful, it could use a little more oomph. I purchased it for my husband who had an earlier Schwinn model which I would have given a 3 star rating. This bike, while was more expensive than the last it is definitely a step up. If you are looking for a good product for the price, I would not hesitate to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Consistent resisitance and confortable to ride
customer_reviews.text: I have an older Schwinn (Model 203) which is constructed entirely differently. This model 230 is easier to get on and off since the metal bar between the seat and the pedals is gone. The unpadded seat is surprisingly comfortable. The beats per minute (heart rate) is for some unknown reason doubled on the digital readout and the mileage estimate is generous compared to the Model 203. I have not contacted Schwinn customer support until I have more experience with the Model 230 (4 weeks).
customer_reviews.author: Bob Lumer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: monitor has failed me twice have asked for replacement but company keeps trying other solutions
customer_reviews.author: Paula F.

customer_reviews.title: Great machine..real customer...real review
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical after reading the reviews but took a shot based on the overall reviews and some of the "reasons" listed to rate the product at a lower rating. I have been using this bike for a couple of months daily without any problems. Quiet, responsive, sturdy (and I'm a decent size dude). Great for exercising or limbering up. Oh, and I put this together in about one (1) hour just sitting there by myself listening to music...no rush, just relaxing. Easy to assemble and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great exercise bike
customer_reviews.text: This was very straightforward to install. The instructions and hardware card are well designed. It does not overwhelm the room as I thought it would. It is actually very sleek. Love the fan and auto shutoff features. And I can easily mount my phone and watch my favorite shows while exercising. Overall I am very satisfied with the product. I bought the Schwinn 230 to save some bucks, as I did not need the extra features that model 270 offers. The only thing I needed was a padded seat, so I bought a seat padding for $40 and put it on the model 230, and it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: paula

product_meta.title: Schwinn Recumbent Bike Series
feature_bullets: Bluetooth connectivity, syncs with the Schwinn Trainer App and other apps for fitness tracking
Sync with free downloadable ride social app and see the world as you virtually ride alongside friends in real time

29 programs: 12 profile, 9 heart rate control, 4 custom, 2 fitness test, 1 quick start. Plugs into any standard electrical wall outlet on an 110V-120V circuit. 120V 60 Hertz AC input; 1.5A output. 90-240V, 50-60 Hertz adapter included
25 levels of resistance for a wide range of workout intensity options and maximum user weight- 300 pounds
High speed, high inertia drive system with a perimeter weighted flywheel for easy start up and smooth, consistent workouts
DualTrack LCD displays, media shelf, in-console speakers with MP3 input port, USB media charging and adjustable fan

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
